009package imagingbook.common.filter.examples;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilterSeparable;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017
018/**
019 * <p>Example filter based on {@link GenericFilterVector} performing
020 * linear convolution with a custom 3x3 filter kernel.
021 * Typically used on RGB color images (with 3-element pixel vectors).
022 * Pixels in scalar-valued images are treated as 1-element vectors.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * Usage:
026 * </p>
027 * <pre>
028 * ImageProcessor ip = ...      // any image but typically a RGB color image
029 * GenericFilter filter = new ExampleFilter3x3Vector();
030 * filter.applyTo(ip);          // modifies ip
031 * </pre>
032 * <p>
033 * Note: This is merely a linear filter with a custom kernel to demonstrate
034 * the concept of a generic filter.
035 * In practice (depending on the type of kernel) this would be implemented
036 * as a sub-class of {@link LinearFilter} or {@link LinearFilterSeparable},
037 * which is much more efficient.
038 * </p>
039 * 
040 * @author WB
041 * @see LinearFilter
042 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
043 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)
044 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor, imagingbook.common.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy)
045 */
046public class ExampleFilter3x3Vector extends GenericFilterVector {
047
048        // custom (nonsymmetric) convolution kernel
049        private final static float[][] H = {
050                        {1, 8, 7},
051                        {2, 9, 6},
052                        {3, 4, 5}};
053        
054        private final static int width = H[0].length;                   // = 3
055        private final static int height = H.length;                             // = 3
056        private final static int xc = width / 2;                                // = 1
057        private final static int yc = height / 2;                               // = 1
058        private final static float s = (float) Matrix.sum(H);
059        
060        @Override
061        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) { // returns float[] pixel value
062                int depth = pack.getDepth();
063                float[] sum = new float[depth];
064                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
065                        int vj = v + j - yc;
066                        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
067                                int ui = u + i - xc;
068                                float[] p = pack.getPix(ui, vj);        // read float[] pixel value
069                                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
070                                        sum[k] = sum[k] + (p[k] * H[i][j]) / s;
071                                }
072                        }
073                }
074                return sum;
075        }
076
077}
